home.title: C Tutorial
paragraphs: C is a general-purpose programming language.
This tutorial will teach you the basics of C programming.

sections.heading: What is C?
paragraphs: C is a general-purpose programming language created by Dennis Ritchie at Bell Laboratories in 1972.
It is widely used and considered a foundational language in computer science.
C was originally developed to create the UNIX operating system.

sections.heading: Why Learn C?
paragraphs: C is one of the most popular programming languages in the world.
It helps you understand how memory and hardware work.
Learning C makes it easier to learn languages like C++, Java, and Python.
C programs are fast and efficient.

paragraphs: A simple C program that prints a greeting.

sections.heading: Basic Syntax Rules
paragraphs: Every C program starts execution from the main() function.
Statements end with a semicolon (;).
C is case-sensitive.

sections.heading: Example
Printing Output
paragraphs: In C, printf() is used to display output on the screen.
It is defined in the stdio.h header file.

sections.heading: Example
What are Comments?
paragraphs: Comments are used to explain code and make it more readable.
They are ignored by the compiler.

sections.heading: Types of Comments
paragraphs: Single-line comments start with //.
Multi-line comments are enclosed between /* and */.

sections.heading: Example
What are Variables?
paragraphs: Variables are used to store data values.
Each variable must be declared with a data type.

sections.heading: Example
Common Data Types
paragraphs: int: stores integers
float: stores decimal numbers
char: stores a single character
double: stores large decimal values
